meanings.definition: A person who talks too much and too loudly, especially in a boastful or self-important manner.
meanings.sent1: The blowhards at the party dominated the conversation with their loud and boastful stories.
meanings.sent2: Some blowhards in the office always try to impress others with their exaggerated tales.
meanings.sent3: The blowhards in the school play were so loud that they almost drowned out the music.
meanings.sent4: The blowhards in the meeting room were like roaring lions, each trying to be the loudest.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the blowhards at the event; their voices echoed in the hall for hours.

meanings.sent1: He blowhards about his achievements every chance he gets.
meanings.sent2: She always blowhards about her expensive possessions to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent3: The little boy blowhards to his friends about how fast he can run.
meanings.sent4: The politician blowhards during his speeches to gain support from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The salesman blowhards about the benefits of his product to attract customers.
